p: To further investigate the origin of the SHG effects in Rb 3Na(H 2C 3N 3O 3) 4·3H 2O, the donation of individual atoms in virtual-electron (VE) transition process was computed using the SHG-density method, and the SHG-density of VE occupied (veocc) and unoccupied (veunocc) states are shown in Figure 5 a,b, respectively. For the occupied state, O p and N p orbitals make a significant contribution to the SHG effect. In unoccupied states, the O p, N p, and C p orbitals make the main contribution. These results indicate that the C–O groups and the (H 2C 3N 3O 3) − π-conjugated groups are the main contributors for Rb 3Na(H 2C 3N 3O 3) 4·3H 2O with large SHG response.
